title: Editors Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Mon Apr 30, 2018 | 7:17am EDT Editors Choice Pictures
Tear gas canisters are fired by Israeli troops at Palestinian demonstrators during clashes at a protest demanding the right to return to their homeland, at the Israel-Gaza border in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa Reuters / Sunday, April 29, 2018 Tear gas canisters are fired by Israeli troops at Palestinian demonstrators during clashes at a protest demanding the right to return to their homeland, at the Israel-Gaza border in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa Close 1 / 24
Members of a caravan of migrants from Central America climb up the border fence between Mexico and the U.S., as a part of a demonstration prior to preparations for an asylum request in the U.S., in Tijuana, Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Reuters / Sunday, April 29, 2018 Members of a caravan of migrants from Central America climb up the border fence between Mexico and the U.S., as a part of a demonstration prior to preparations for an asylum request in the U.S., in Tijuana, Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Close 2 / 24
President Trump walks on South Lawn of the White House in Washington, U.S., before his departure to Michigan. REUTERS/Yuri Gripas Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 President Trump walks on South Lawn of the White House in Washington, U.S., before his departure to Michigan. REUTERS/Yuri Gripas Close 3 / 24
A baby cries in the arms of an amateur sumo wrestler during a baby crying contest at Sensoji temple in Tokyo, Japan. In the contest two wrestlers each hold a baby while a referee makes faces and loud noises to make them cry. The baby who cries the... more Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 A baby cries in the arms of an amateur sumo wrestler during a baby crying contest at Sensoji temple in Tokyo, Japan. In the contest two wrestlers each hold a baby while a referee makes faces and loud noises to make them cry. The baby who cries the loudest wins. The ritual is believed to aid the healthy growth of the children and ward off evil spirits. 160 children took part in the event in this year, the organizer said. REUTERS/Issei Kato Close 4 / 24
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un bids farewell to South Korean President Moon Jae-in as he leaves after a farewell ceremony at the truce village of Panmunjom inside the demilitarized zone separating the two Koreas, South Korea. Korea Summit Press... more Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 North Korean leader Kim Jong Un bids farewell to South Korean President Moon Jae-in as he leaves after a farewell ceremony at the truce village of Panmunjom inside the demilitarized zone separating the two Koreas, South Korea. Korea Summit Press Pool/Pool via Reuters Close 5 / 24
Performers dressed as mermaids dive into the 10-metre-deep Ambassador Lagoon inside Atlantis Sanya hotel in Sanya, Hainan province, China. REUTERS/Bobby Yip Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 Performers dressed as mermaids dive into the 10-metre-deep Ambassador Lagoon inside Atlantis Sanya hotel in Sanya, Hainan province, China. REUTERS/Bobby Yip Close 6 / 24
Joseph James DeAngelo, 72, who authorities said was identified by DNA evidence as the serial predator dubbed the Golden State Killer, appears at his arraignment in California Superior court in Sacramento, California. REUTERS/Fred Greaves Reuters / Friday, April 27, 2018 Joseph James DeAngelo, 72, who authorities said was identified by DNA evidence as the serial predator dubbed the Golden State Killer, appears at his arraignment in California Superior court in Sacramento, California. REUTERS/Fred Greaves Close 7 / 24
People gather at the rooftop of the Metropolitan Cathedral during a protest march to demand an end to violence in Managua, Nicaragua. REUTERS /Jose Cabezas Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 People gather at the rooftop of the Metropolitan Cathedral during a protest march to demand an end to violence in Managua, Nicaragua. REUTERS /Jose Cabezas Close 8 / 24
A man and his daughter, members of a migrant caravan from Central America, run between pigeons at the end of their journey through Mexico, prior to preparations for an asylum request in the U.S., in Tijuana, Baja California state, Mexico.... more Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 A man and his daughter, members of a migrant caravan from Central America, run between pigeons at the end of their journey through Mexico, prior to preparations for an asylum request in the U.S., in Tijuana, Baja California state, Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Close 9 / 24
A man takes part in a "Bison race" competition with different kind of obstacles in a field near the town of Lahoysk, Belarus. REUTERS/Vasily Fedosenko Reuters / Sunday, April 29, 2018 A man takes part in a "Bison race" competition with different kind of obstacles in a field near the town of Lahoysk, Belarus. REUTERS/Vasily Fedosenko Close 10 / 24
A Fiorentina fan flies on a drone inside the stadium before their match against Napoli. REUTERS/Alberto Lingria Reuters / Sunday, April 29, 2018 A Fiorentina fan flies on a drone inside the stadium before their match against Napoli. REUTERS/Alberto Lingria Close 11 / 24
A woman enjoys a sunbath at the pier on the Adriatic Sea in Brela, Croatia. REUTERS/Antonio Bronic Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 A woman enjoys a sunbath at the pier on the Adriatic Sea in Brela, Croatia. REUTERS/Antonio Bronic Close 12 / 24
The 2nd century Roman amphitheatre is flooded following heavy rain in the historic southern town of Bosra al-Sham, Syria. REUTERS/Alaa al Faqir Reuters / Sunday, April 29, 2018 The 2nd century Roman amphitheatre is flooded following heavy rain in the historic southern town of Bosra al-Sham, Syria. REUTERS/Alaa al Faqir Close
Participants take part in the Annual Sikh Day Parade in Lisbon, Portugal. REUTERS/Rafael Marchante Reuters / Sunday, April 29, 2018 Participants take part in the Annual Sikh Day Parade in Lisbon, Portugal. REUTERS/Rafael Marchante Close 14 / 24
Visitors fight with the wind as the Marine One helicopter with U.S. President Donald Trump departs from the White House in Washington. REUTERS/Yuri Gripas Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 Visitors fight with the wind as the Marine One helicopter with U.S. President Donald Trump departs from the White House in Washington. REUTERS/Yuri Gripas Close 15 / 24
Ethnic Miao people play bamboo lushengs at the Lusheng Festival as a traditional way of praying for a good harvest in Congjiang county, Guizhou province, China. REUTERS/Stringer Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 Ethnic Miao people play bamboo lushengs at the Lusheng Festival as a traditional way of praying for a good harvest in Congjiang county, Guizhou province, China. REUTERS/Stringer Close 16 / 24
Houthi supporters hold posters of Saleh al-Samad, a senior Houthi official, during a funeral procession held for him and his six body guards, killed by Saudi-led air strikes last week, in Sanaa, Yemen. REUTERS/Mohamed al-Sayaghi Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 Houthi supporters hold posters of Saleh al-Samad, a senior Houthi official, during a funeral procession held for him and his six body guards, killed by Saudi-led air strikes last week, in Sanaa, Yemen. REUTERS/Mohamed al-Sayaghi Close 17 / 24
A tank, operated by forces loyal to Syria's President Bashar al-Assad, opens fire near the Yarmouk Palestinian camp in Damascus, Syria. REUTERS/Omar Sanadiki Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 A tank, operated by forces loyal to Syria's President Bashar al-Assad, opens fire near the Yarmouk Palestinian camp in Damascus, Syria. REUTERS/Omar Sanadiki Close 18 / 24
A worker sitting on a cart plants vines of Cabernet Sauvignon grapes in a field on the outskirts of the village of Flaibano, located in the Fruili region of Italy. REUTERS/David Gray Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 A worker sitting on a cart plants vines of Cabernet Sauvignon grapes in a field on the outskirts of the village of Flaibano, located in the Fruili region of Italy. REUTERS/David Gray Close 19 / 24
A woman reacts as she views the spectacular azaleas and rhodedendron blossoming in Richmond Park in west London, Britain. REUTERS/Toby Melville Reuters / Sunday, April 29, 2018 A woman reacts as she views the spectacular azaleas and rhodedendron blossoming in Richmond Park in west London, Britain. REUTERS/Toby Melville Close
Fire fighter extinguishes fire on a landfill outside Yangon, Myanmar. REUTERS/Stringer Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 Fire fighter extinguishes fire on a landfill outside Yangon, Myanmar. REUTERS/Stringer Close 21 / 24
A wounded Palestinian falls on the ground during clashes with Israeli troops at a protest where Palestinians demand the right to return to their homeland, at the Israel-Gaza border in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa Reuters / Friday, April 27, 2018 A wounded Palestinian falls on the ground during clashes with Israeli troops at a protest where Palestinians demand the right to return to their homeland, at the Israel-Gaza border in the southern Gaza Strip. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa Close
A view of bubbles as West Ham United plays Manchester City. REUTERS/David Klein Reuters / Sunday, April 29, 2018 A view of bubbles as West Ham United plays Manchester City. REUTERS/David Klein Close 23 / 24
A yoga enthusiast rest after a class at the Samalayuca dunes, on the outskirts of Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Reuters / Saturday, April 28, 2018 A yoga enthusiast rest after a class at the Samalayuca dunes, on the outskirts of Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Close
